title: MVP Launch: Free vs Paid tier definition and limits
description: Define and implement free tier limits (2 dialogs ever, 1x15min audio course) and paid tier limits. Decide between  and  pricing. Add upgrade prompts when limits reached.

title: MVP Launch: Pre-generated sample content system
description: Create pre-generated sample content (3 dialogues + 1 audio course) for each language/level combination. Add logic to populate user library during onboarding.

title: Generate sample audio courses for all language/level combinations
description: Generate 1 pre-made audio course for each language/level combination on the topic: Travel & Transportation. Should cover getting around, public transit, asking directions, and navigating new places at the appropriate proficiency level.

title: MVP Launch: Tidying up and nice-to-haves
description: Final polish and nice-to-have features before launch.

title: Choose 3 dialogue topics for sample content
description: Selected 3 dialogue topics: (1) Meeting Someone New - introductions and basic conversation, (2) At a Café/Restaurant - ordering food and drinks, (3) Making Weekend Plans - friends discussing activities

title: Pulse point: Guide user to add audio course keywords to flashcards
description: Create pulse point to teach users how to add keywords from audio courses to their flashcard deck.

title: Generate sample dialogues for all language/level combinations
description: Generate 3 pre-made dialogues for each language/level combination using the chosen topics: (1) Meeting Someone New, (2) At a Café/Restaurant, (3) Making Weekend Plans. Each dialogue should be level-appropriate and culturally adaptable.

title: MVP Launch: User analytics tracking
description: Add analytics for: time spent doing reviews, time spent listening, total time on site.

title: Decide between  and  pricing for paid tier
description: Decision: Paid tier will be /month. This better positions the value proposition and provides higher revenue per user while remaining affordable. Free tier remains limited to encourage upgrades.

title: Remove country flags from language selection
description: Decision: Remove country flags and use language names only (e.g., 'Japanese', 'Spanish', 'Chinese', 'French', 'Arabic', 'English'). Clean, unambiguous text labels without political associations. Update onboarding flow and settings page.

title: MVP Launch: Onboarding UX improvements
description: Design pass on onboarding. Replace 'native language' with better terminology. Remove problematic country flags for languages.

title: Define free tier limits (2 dialogs, 1x15min audio course)
description: Free tier limits: Users can create max 2 dialogues ever and 1x15min audio course ever (not per week, total lifetime limit). Pre-made sample content does not count against these limits. After hitting limits, users are prompted to upgrade to /month paid tier.

title: Replace 'native language' terminology with better alternative
description: Decision: Replace 'native language' with 'Primary Language' throughout the app. This is friendly, accessible, and avoids loaded assumptions about linguistic identity. Update all UI text, database fields, and documentation.

title: Build onboarding logic to add pre-made content to user library
description: Implement logic to automatically add the 3 dialogues and 1 audio course to new users' libraries based on their selected language/level during onboarding.

title: Choose 1 audio course topic for sample content
description: Selected audio course topic: Travel & Transportation - getting around, public transit, asking directions, navigating new places

title: Implement upgrade prompts when free tier limits reached
description: Show upgrade prompts to users when they hit their free tier content creation limits.

title: MVP Launch: User guidance pulse points
description: Add pulse points to guide users through app: 1) show pre-generated content and usage, 2) guide to add audio keywords to flashcards, 3) guide to create first custom content.

title: MVP Launch: Flashcard experience improvements
description: Improve quality of flashcard experience before release.

title: Define and implement paid tier content limits
description: Paid tier (/month) limits: Keep current 20 content items per week (resets Monday 00:00 UTC). This provides generous allowance for active learners while preventing abuse. Paid users also get access to all content types and features.

title: Pulse point: Show pre-generated content and how to use it
description: Create pulse point guidance to show users the pre-generated content in their library and explain how to use it.

title: Design pass for onboarding UI/UX
description: Improve the visual design and user experience of the onboarding flow. Make it less generic and more engaging.

title: Pulse point: Guide user to create their first custom content
description: Create pulse point to encourage and guide users through creating their first piece of custom content.

title: Allow users to delete pre-made content from library
description: Users should be able to remove pre-generated content from their library if they don't want it.
